DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety of lenalidomide and to define the maximum tolerated escalation dose level (MTEDL) when administered by a stepwise dose-escalation schedule in subjects with relapsed or refractory B-cell CLL.
DOC.brief_title: A Dose Escalation Study of Lenalidomide in Relapsed or Refractory B-cell Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
DOC.criteria: Documented diagnosis of Bcell CLL that has relapsed after or is refractory to at least one prior regimen. The prior regimen(s) must have included an alkylating agent and fludarabine (used in combination or separately) ECOG < or = 2 Willing to agree to follow the pregnancy precautions. Pregnant or nursing women Systemic treatment for Bcell CLL within 28 days of study start Central nervous system involvement History of renal failure requiring dialysis Prior treatment with lenalidomide Alemtuzumab therapy within 56 days of initiating lenalidomide treatment ANC < 1000 / ul Platelet count < 50,000 / ul Calculated creatinine clearance < 60 mL/min (CockroftGault method) AST or ALT > 3.0 x upper limit of normal Serum total bilirubin > 2.0 mg/dl Neuropathy > or = Grade 2 Uncontrolled autoimmune hemolytic anemia or thrombocytopenia Richter's transformation (active)
